Material used.Material Source: Human brain tissue and cell lines
Material used.Description: Studies conducted using postmortem brain tissue and HEK293 cells.

Readout description.Result Description: The variant reduces Parkin ubiquitination activity, correlating with disease progression.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Parkin ubiquitination activity greater than 80% in control samples.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Parkin ubiquitination activity less than 50% in mutant samples.

Material used.Description: Experiments conducted using HEK293 cells with siRNA knockdown and plasmid overexpression.

Readout description.Result Description: Knockdown of PARK2 (p.G201R) led to increased alpha-synuclein aggregation, while overexpression reduced it.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 overexpression served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Scrambled siRNA was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Alpha-synuclein aggregation levels below 20% in control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Alpha-synuclein aggregation levels above 40% in mutant cells.

Material used.Material Name: Postmortem brain tissue from PD patients
Material used.Description: Immunohistochemistry and biochemical assays performed on postmortem brain tissue.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced Parkin immunoreactivity and increased Lewy body pathology in PD brains with the variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each slide was analyzed in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Normal brain tissue was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: No primary antibody was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Chi-square test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Parkin immunoreactivity above 50% in normal brain tissue.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Parkin immunoreactivity below 30% in PD brains with the variant.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Cell viability assays and ubiquitination studies

Material used.Description: Cell viability assays and ubiquitination studies conducted on SH-SY5Y cells.

Readout description.Result Description: The variant significantly reduced cell viability and impaired ubiquitination of target proteins.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 overexpression served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability above 80% in control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability below 50% in mutant cells.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Molecular dynamics simulations and co-immunoprecipitation experiments

Material used.Description: Molecular dynamics simulations and co-immunoprecipitation experiments conducted on HEK293 and SH-SY5Y cells.

Readout description.Result Description: The variant disrupts Parkin's interaction with ubiquitin ligase substrates, confirmed via co-immunoprecipitation.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PARK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Ubiquitin ligase interaction above 70% in control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Ubiquitin ligase interaction below 30% in mutant cells.
